Class Menu

    public class Menu
extends java.lang.Object
implements InterfaceMenu

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void cabecera(java.lang.String s)
      This method prints a header for every menu and sub-menu in our system The word cabecera means header in Spanish It takes the parameter:
      void deleteMenu()
      This method uses the Robot class to create an instance of it to simulate key strokes.
      void goBack(int where)
      Since we use the option to "Go Back" several times throughout our code we have created this method This method gives the option to "Go Back" to the previous menu depending in which sub-menu we are on It takes a parameter:
      void mainMenu()
      This Method creates the Main Menu for our Schedule System This menu gives us the options: [1] Flights [2] Airplanes [3] Pilots [4] exit
      void menuAirplanes()
      This Method shows us the airplanes that we have in our system.
      void menuFlights()
      This Method creates a menu to manage the flights in the system This menu gives us the options: [1] Display all Flights [2] Update Flights [3] Go Back
      void menuPilots()
      This method shows us the pilots that we have in our system.
      void showFlightsSimplified()
      This method prints a simplified version of the flights for practical purposes.
      void showPilotsSimplified()
      This method prints a simplified version of the pilots for practical purposes.
      void subDisplayAllFlights()
      The method shows you all the airplanes that are "stored" in our system It gives us only one option [1] Go Back
      void updateArrival()
      This method updates the Arrival time of the flight.
      void updateFlight()
      This Method creates a Sub-menu to update the Flights.
      void updateFlightsPilot(java.lang.String type)
      This method changes the Flight's pilot and copilot This method shows you, first, the flights in a simplified version and after choosing flight it shows you the pilots Not all pilots can be the first pilot of the aircraft (depending of the license) but all pilots can be copilot It takes the parameter:
      void updateSchedule()
      This method updates the Schedule of the flight, in other words The Departure and The Arrival Time.
      java.lang.String updateTime(java.lang.String type)
      This method validates time inputs and returns this time input whenever the user does it properly it takes the parameter:
      boolean validateTime(java.lang.String time)
      This method is the responsible for the validation side of the previous method, updateTime(String type).

      • subDisplayAllFlights

        public void subDisplayAllFlights()
        The method shows you all the airplanes that are "stored" in our system It gives us only one option [1] Go Back
        Specified by:
        subDisplayAllFlights in interface InterfaceMenu

      • updateFlight

        public void updateFlight()
        This Method creates a Sub-menu to update the Flights. This Sub-menu gives us the options: [1] Update Pilot. [2] Update Copilot. [3] Update Schedule (Departure and Arrival times). [4] Update Arrival time. [5] Go Back. Only the flights that have been created in the MAIN are going to be updated.
        Specified by:
        updateFlight in interface InterfaceMenu

      • updateFlightsPilot

        public void updateFlightsPilot(java.lang.String type)
        This method changes the Flight's pilot and copilot This method shows you, first, the flights in a simplified version and after choosing flight it shows you the pilots Not all pilots can be the first pilot of the aircraft (depending of the license) but all pilots can be copilot It takes the parameter:
        Specified by:
        updateFlightsPilot in interface InterfaceMenu
        Parameters:
        type - this indicates the type of pilot to update, either Pilot or Copilot

      • updateSchedule

        public void updateSchedule()
        This method updates the Schedule of the flight, in other words The Departure and The Arrival Time. There is no mandatory condition in this case, because we can update both, the departure and the arrival at any time
        Specified by:
        updateSchedule in interface InterfaceMenu

      • updateArrival

        public void updateArrival()
        This method updates the Arrival time of the flight. Here, it is mandatory to have the Schedule set to be able to change/update the arrival time of the flight This Method can be absorbed by the updateSchedule() method by passing a control parameter to tell the computer what to do. For the scope of this project we are going to work it separately.
        Specified by:
        updateArrival in interface InterfaceMenu

      • menuAirplanes

        public void menuAirplanes()
        This Method shows us the airplanes that we have in our system. It only waits for the user to tell him to go back
        Specified by:
        menuAirplanes in interface InterfaceMenu

      • menuPilots

        public void menuPilots()
        This method shows us the pilots that we have in our system. It only waits for the user to tell him to go back.

      • goBack

        public void goBack(int where)
        Since we use the option to "Go Back" several times throughout our code we have created this method This method gives the option to "Go Back" to the previous menu depending in which sub-menu we are on It takes a parameter:
        Specified by:
        goBack in interface InterfaceMenu
        Parameters:
        where - that indicates in which menu we call this method

      • deleteMenu

        public void deleteMenu()
        This method uses the Robot class to create an instance of it to simulate key strokes. This key strokes are use to focus the output window of neat beans (Ctrl+4) and to clean it whenever a new menu is opened (Ctrl+L) This Robot is quite unstable so, we have to play with the delay time to make it work properly. We are eager to ask you about this class and comment about its problems.
        Specified by:
        deleteMenu in interface InterfaceMenu

      • showFlightsSimplified

        public void showFlightsSimplified()
        This method prints a simplified version of the flights for practical purposes. The flights are printed as follows: [index+1] from: Origin to: Destination date: DateOfFlight
        Specified by:
        showFlightsSimplified in interface InterfaceMenu

      • showPilotsSimplified

        public void showPilotsSimplified()
        This method prints a simplified version of the pilots for practical purposes. The Pilots are printed as follows: [index+1] PilotsName License: PilotsLicense
        Specified by:
        showPilotsSimplified in interface InterfaceMenu

      • updateTime

        public java.lang.String updateTime(java.lang.String type)
        This method validates time inputs and returns this time input whenever the user does it properly it takes the parameter:
        Specified by:
        updateTime in interface InterfaceMenu
        Parameters:
        type - to check what time it is being updated, arrival or departure
        Returns:
        returns the departure or arrival time, depending on the type parameter

        Specified by:
